info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Fulton, northwestern Schoharie and Montgomery Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cherry Valley, or 9 miles southwest of Canajoharie, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ames around 715 PM EDT. Canajoharie and Fort Plain around 720 PM EDT. Fonda around 735 PM EDT. Gloversville, Johnstown and Tribes Hill around 740 PM EDT. Amsterdam and Fort Johnson around 745 PM EDT. Broadalbin, Hagaman and Mayfield around 750 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Meco, Charleston, West Perth, Beekman Corners, Fultonville, Rockwell Corners, Engleville, Young Corners, Gardnersville and Hale Mills. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 27 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
